thread.title: Starc knocks over Kohli as Aussies stun hosts
thread.title_full: Starc knocks over Kohli as Aussies stun hosts

title: Starc knocks over Kohli as Aussies stun hosts
text:
Australia v India Test series 2017: all the action from an exciting day two in Pune  29pm by Ben Horne Source: The Daily Telegraph MITCHELL Starc has cracked open the Test series in India in spectacular fashion, dethroning King Kohli in a devastating spell of fast bowling. 
On a pitch supposed to suit the spinners, Starc roared back into his second spell and in the space of three balls dispatched top order stars Cheteshwar Pujara and Virat Kohli. 
The double-wicket maiden followed up Starc’s (2-22) momentum-changing 61 with the bat and a superb initial breakthrough from fast bowling ally Josh Hazlewood, who nicked off opener Murali Vijay for just 10. 
At lunch on day two, India are 3-70 after Lokesh Rahul (47 not out) and Ajinkya Rahane fought hard to stop the bleeding. 
But Australia find themselves in the match up to their eyeballs. 
After an expert bowling change from skipper Steve Smith, Starc found WACA-esque bounce and pace in a wicket as dry as most experts have ever seen to catch the edge of Pujara with a jaffa of a delivery. 
He then sent shockwaves through the Indian dressing room when he had the world’s most feared batsman Kohli slashing at a wide one outside off-stump to leave India in uncharted territory at 3-44 chasing Australia’s first innings total of 260. Mitchell Starc has enjoyed early success on day two in Pune. Source: AFP 
It was the first time since 2014 that Kohli had fallen for a duck and the Australian team exploded around Starc in jubilation. 
“The change room won’t be able to believe Virat Kohli is out for zero,” said Michael Clarke on Star Sports. 
“Talk about things being different. 
“The Indian captain back in the rooms for zero is not something the Indian team or fans are used to seeing.” 
Another former Australian captain Mark Taylor made a similar observation before the series, arguing that if Kohli fell cheaply the Indian dressing room might panic. 
It’s now up to the Australian attack to finish the job. 
Smith opened with Starc and spinner Steve O’Keefe from the other end, preferring to rotate his pacemen one at a time. 
Pinpoint operator Hazlewood hit the mark right from the outset, setting the trap for Vijay and then dismissing him in his very first over. 
There was little Pujara could do to stay out of the way of a screaming delivery from Starc that took off and caught his gloves on the way through to keeper Matt Wade. 
Kohli was then caught out slashing at a wide one, with Starc claiming the most prized wicket in world cricket.
